    • createAnswer

      @Blocking public org.json.JSONObject createAnswer()
      This method is used to create an answer for a WebRTC connection. It creates a Session Description Protocol (SDP) answer and customizes it. The method is blocking due to the use of CompletableFuture.join() calls.
      Returns:
      A JSONObject containing the type of the message ("answer") and the SDP of the answer. The returned JSONObject will look like this: 
       {
   "type": "answer",
   "sdp": "<sdp answer description string>"
 }

      Steps:

      1. A CompletableFuture for RTCSessionDescription is created.

      2. An RTCAnswerOptions object is created and passed to the createAnswer method of the RTCPeerConnection instance.

      3. The RTCSessionDescription for the answer is retrieved by calling the join method on the CompletableFuture.

      4. A JSONObject named jsep is created with the type of the message set to "answer" and the SDP set to the SDP of the answer.

      5. The customizeSdp method is called to customize the SDP in the jsep object.

      6. The setLocalDescription method of the RTCPeerConnection instance is called with the answer.

      7. The join method is called on the CompletableFuture to block until the local description is set.

      8. The jsep object is returned.

      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the generated RTC answer description is null. The customizeSdp method is called to apply any additional customizations to the SDP answer. This method uses the PeerConnection's createAnswer method to generate the RTC answer. The SDP answer is then customized using the customizeSdp method. The local description of the PeerConnection is set to the generated answer.
      See Also:
      • RTCSessionDescription
      • RTCAnswerOptions
      • JanusPeerConnection.CreateSDObserver
      • JanusPeerConnection.CreateSetSessionDescriptionObserver
      • customizeSdp(JSONObject)

    • sendSDP

      public void sendSDP()

    • createOffer

      @Blocking public org.json.JSONObject createOffer()
      Creates an RTC offer for establishing a WebRTC session. This method generates an offer using the configured PeerConnection and returns a JSONObject representing the offer in SDP format.
      Returns:
      A JSONObject representing the RTC offer in SDP format, with additional customizations if any.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the generated RTC offer description is null. The returned JSONObject has the following structure: 
       {
   "type": "answer",
   "sdp": "<sdp answer description string>"
 }
      This method uses the PeerConnection's createOffer method to generate the RTC offer. The SDP offer is then customized using the customizeSdp method. The local description of the PeerConnection is set to the generated offer.
      See Also:
      • RTCSessionDescription
      • RTCOfferOptions
      • JanusPeerConnection.CreateSDObserver
      • JanusPeerConnection.CreateSetSessionDescriptionObserver
      • customizeSdp(JSONObject)
